item.title: Decompiling Swift
item.description: In this post, I'll describe the new features I added to the language definition DSL I've been working on in order to support decompiling Swift (and hopefully other languages).

item.title: Looping Un-Splitting
item.description: In this post, I'll be talking about a new compiler optimization I learned about and how I deoptimized it using z3 for nicer decompiled code.

item.title: Decompiling blocks in Objective-C
item.description: While decompiling some Objective-C code, I came across the following function...

item.title: A DSL for generating source code
item.description: One of the reasons I want to write a decompiler is to be able to decompile languages other than C. Although many languages descend from C and therefore their decompiler should inherit much of the same logic from a C decompiler.

item.title: About
item.description:
This is a site where I document experiments and development in my decompiler.

I'm learning about compilers/decompilers as I go and reinventing the wheel lots so if I get anything wrong or if you have suggestions, let me know.

decompilersnstuff on gmail
